history.proof: intros H1 H2. split. - intros H3. unfold FRACTRAN_HALTING in H3. destruct l as [| [p q] l'] eqn:Heq. + contradiction H1; reflexivity. + apply FRACTRAN_HALTING_on_zero_first_no_zero_den in H3 as []. contradict H3. sauto lq: on depth: 3. - intros H3. contradict H3.

ctx: destruct l as [| [p q] l'] eqn:Heq.
exceptions.exn: [Focus] Wrong bullet -: Current bullet + is not finished.

I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

FRACTRAN_HALTING_on_zero_first_no_zero_den : forall (p q : nat) l, q <> 0 -> FRACTRAN_HALTING ((p, q) :: l, 0) < -> False
FRACTRAN_HALTING_0_num : forall l (x : nat), Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, x) < -> False
FRACTRAN_HALTING_zero_num : forall l (x : nat), Exists (fun c : nat * nat => fst c = 0) l -> FRACTRAN_HALTING (l, x) < -> False
fractran_rt_no_zero_den_0_0 : forall l, l <> nil -> fractran_regular l -> l /F/ 0 → 0
fractran_stop = fun l (x : nat) => forall z : nat, ~ l /F/ x → z : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_stop _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_steps = fun l => rel_iter (fractran_step l) : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_steps _%list_scope (_ _ _)%nat_scope
fractran_compute = fun l (x y : nat) => exists n : nat, fractran_steps l n x y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_compute _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_terminates = fun l (x : nat) => exists y : nat, fractran_compute l x y /\ fractran_stop l y : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> Prop Arguments fractran_terminates _%list_scope _%nat_scope
fractran_step_inv : forall (P : list (nat * nat)) (x y : nat), P /F/ x → y -> exists l (p q : nat) (r : list (nat * nat)), P = l ++ (p, q) :: r /\ (forall u v : nat, In (u, v) l -> ~ divides v (u * x)) /\ q * y = p * x
fractran_step_zero : forall l, Forall (fun c : nat * nat => fst c <> 0) l -> forall x y : nat, x <> 0 -> l /F/ x → y < -> remove_zero_den l /F/ x → y
FRACTRAN_REG_PROBLEM = {l : list (nat * nat) & {_ : nat | fractran_regular l}} : Set
list_max_lt : forall (l : list nat) (n : nat), l <> nil -> list_max l < n < -> Forall (fun k : nat => k < n) l
fractran_step_ind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
fractran_step_sind : forall P : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> (forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> P l x y -> P ((p, q) :: l) x y) -> forall l (n n0 : nat), l /F/ n → n0 -> P l n n0
Inductive fractran_step : list (nat * nat) -> nat -> nat -> Prop := in_fractran_0 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), q * y = p * x -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y | in_fractran_1 : forall (p q : nat) l (x y : nat), ~ divides q (p * x) -> l /F/ x → y -> (p, q) :: l /F/ x → y Arguments fractran_step _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_0 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_fractran_1 (_ _)%nat_scope _%list_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
fractran_step_bound : forall l, fractran_regular l -> {k : nat | forall x y : nat, l /F/ x → y -> y <= k * x}
app_removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), l <> nil -> l = removelast l ++ last l d :: nil

```coq
intros H1 H2.
split.
- intros H3.
  unfold FRACTRAN_HALTING in H3.
  unfold FRACTRAN_PROBLEM in H3.
  destruct l as [| [p q] l'] eqn:Heq.
  + contradiction H1; reflexivity.
  + apply FRACTRAN_HALTING_on_zero_first_no_zero_den in H3 as [].
    * contradict H3.
- intros H3.
  unfold not; intros H4.
  contradict H3.
Qed.
Qed.
```
